Overview.p: Grist is a modern relational spreadsheet that combines the flexibility of a spreadsheet with the robustness of a database to organize your data and boost productivity.

This repository, grist-core, is maintained by Grist Labs. Our flagship product, available at getgrist.com, is built from the code you see here, combined with business-specific software designed to scale it to many users, handle billing, etc.

li.br: Visit getgrist.com to use Grist online.
Check out our roadmap for future developments.

Drop a question in our forum.
Browse our extensive documentation.

p.strong: To use a Port other than 8484:

Overview.p: In this example, we'll use port 9251:
Toggle Advanced View in the upper right-hand corner.

ol.li: Change WebUI: from http://[IP]:[PORT:8484]/ to your desired port number, for example: http://[IP]:[PORT:9251]/

Click Add another Path, Port, Variable, Label or Device at the bottom and add a Variable with the following:
Config Type: Variable
Name: Custom Port
Key: PORT
Value: 9251
Click Add.

Click the Remove button for the Container Port.
Click Add another Path, Port, Variable, Label or Device at the bottom and add a Port with the following:
Config Type: Port
Name: Container Port
Container Port: 9251
Host Port: 9251
Click Add.

Overview.p: Grist offers a blend of spreadsheet flexibility and database robustness to help you organize data effectively and enhance productivity.
